snippet: Under the new coding regime, government programs and private insurers will require doctors, hospitals, clinics and nursing homes to report vastly more information about the care they provide patients.
abstract: Health care providers across United States are increasingly anxious about introduction of more than 100,000 new codes they will be required to use; codes were drawn up according to 10th revision of International Classification of Disease and must be used starting in October; codes could compel doctors to make more in-depth assessments of patients, but providers worry transitioning to new system will lead to some claims and payments being denied or delayed.
lead_paragraph: Under the new coding regime, government programs and private insurers will require doctors, hospitals, clinics and nursing homes to report vastly more information about the care they provide patients.

headline.main: One Symptom in New Medical Codes: Doctor Anxiety
headline.print_headline: One Symptom in New Codes: Doctor Anxiety
